text: (upbeat music)
- Hey guys, it's Michael.

I am a chemical engineering
major at Cornell University.
- I'm a computer science major
here at Oregon State University,
with a focus on cybersecurity.
- I'm majoring in chemical engineering
at the University of Notre Dame.

- I am working towards
an associate's degree

in the IT field at Northern
Virginia Community College.
- I am currently a computer science major
at Towson University.
- I am a computer science major.

I really love having to solve
different problems every day.

- I'm a computer science major
at George Mason University,
and I'm a proud recipient of the AWS
InCommunities scholarship.
(upbeat music continues)
- Some of my career plans after college

is to become a biochemical
engineer that integrates

genetic engineering more
safely into medicine.

- My dream is to be able
to join a research team

leading development in
NextGen AI and robotics.

- My career plans for the future
involve creating a startup

that hopefully has some
long-lasting change and impact
in areas where it's desperately needed,
such as oceanic pollution.
- After college, I wanna go to grad school
and get my PhD in mechanical engineering,

hoping to one day enter
the medical device field,

where I can design
technologies that improve
surgical outcomes.
(cheerful rock music)
♪ Whoo ♪
- The AWS scholarship has really helped me
by funding my tuition,

which has allowed me to find
clubs, such as Cornell iGEM.

That really connected me
with like-minded people
to further advance me in my career.
- AWS has given me the opportunity

to attend a Top 15
university and take advantage
of every opportunity offered to me.

- I would not have been able
to come to a place like Cornell

had it not been for scholarship
opportunities like AWS.
- It allows me to spend more time
volunteering in my research lab,

gaining those valuable
skills and experience
that I'll need for a career in research,

rather than working a part-time
job just to make ends meet.
- I think that without this scholarship,
I wouldn't have the opportunity to meet

that many professors,
get involved in research.

I've made so many
connections through Miami,
and through the help of this scholarship,

but I think none of that
would've been achievable
if I didn't apply for this.
(upbeat music)

- My last words to anyone
thinking of applying
is to absolutely do it!

- There's really no harm, and
you only stand to benefit.
- I wholeheartedly encourage you to do so.

It may just help you
work towards your dream.
- I highly recommend just going for it,

showing who you are,
talking about your passions.

- Everyone is unique, with
a different background,
so your story is worth telling.
- My best advice is kind of cliche,
but it's just to go for it.
- Believe in and trust in yourself.
- Absolutely just do it.

- I personally didn't think
I was going to get it,
and now here I am making this video.
So I believe in you. You got this.
(upbeat music)
